pr_title: Add new configuration option to limit the size of string attribute values

timeline.message: Add new configuration option to limit the size of string attribute values

timeline.bodyText: Add comment about 0 here too or SDK may handle it incorrectly
timeline.author: anuraaga
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -144,6 +149,13 @@ public static TraceConfig getDefault() {
    */
   public abstract int getMaxNumberOfAttributesPerLink();
 
+  /**
+   * Returns the global default max length of string attribute value in characters.
+   *
+   * @return the global default max length of string attribute value in characters.

timeline.bodyText: Looks like null check is duplicated with private method
timeline.author: anuraaga
anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: Believe it's possible for string to be null. Guess you can just use cutIfNeeded here too.
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: I wanted to avoid allocating new AttributeValue unless needed...
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: Well, actually it cannot. null value will not even reach this method. But I will add an if anyway
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText:
Thanks, yeah didn't notice the reallocation of AttributeValue aspect. As far as null goes, I only thought of it from seeing the null check in this PR
https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/pull/1437/files
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: Ah sorry should have mentioned both return value and parameter are @Nullable
timeline.author: anuraaga
jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: recommend including why it failed, not just that the value is invalid. maybe "attribute value limit must be positive"
timeline.author: jkwatson
jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: Is zero a good default? shouldn't it be MAX_INT?
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: even better, make the default be a null Integer and get rid of this magic number.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText:
All other methods here return int. Do you want for this one to return Integer?
With default value being MAX_INT the code will look like if(traceConfig.getMaxLengthOfAttributeValues() < Integer.MAX_INT) truncate(), which is strange for me.
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: I also agree that 0 is strange as a default value. I would set it to a more common magic number, e.g. 255.
replies.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: How about if(traceConfig.getMaxLengthOfAttributeValues() != TraceConfig.DEFAULT_MAX_ATTRIBUTE_LENGTH) ? I think that reads great, makes it clear, and doesn't use '0' as a magic number.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Also, why is the word 'KEY' in this constant name?
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText:
Oi, KEY is certainly wrong, will fix.
Do you propose to have TraceConfig.DEFAULT_MAX_ATTRIBUTE_LENGTH constant but let it have null as a value or Integer.MAX_VALUE?
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: I think I prefer MAX_VALUE, to the nullable, but I don't feel super strongly about it.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Wait, that does not make sense. Currently I attempt to truncate values if configured value differs from "unlimited" which is signalled by 0. Your proposal says "let's try to truncate if configured value is not default". But what if we change default to, say, 2M? if(traceConfig.getMaxLengthOfAttributeValues() != TraceConfig.DEFAULT_MAX_ATTRIBUTE_LENGTH) will not work anymore. Compare with default is wrong, default may change. We have to compare with "unlimited", however we denote that. And I like traceConfig.getMaxLengthOfAttributeValues() > 0 more than traceConfig.getMaxLengthOfAttributeValues() > Integer.MAX_INT.
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: I'd be happier with -1, rather than 0. 0 is actually a valid length, and -1 clearly is not. And, I'd rather have a constant defined for the "unset" value, rather than just hardcode the magic number in two places.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: 👍 I like -1 for unlimited, I think that's reasonably conventional
replies.author: trask
